item.title: Fire spell boolean
item.dc:creator: @JxS JxS
item.description:
@JxS wrote:

Shut your face gmaster.

The reason the graphics won’t show up is because you have bad ids for… all of them. They have to be specifically made for moving, like for magic or range.

Also the offset numbers are for something different. The first numbers, where you have offsets, should be YOUR coordinates, and then the second should be somewhere near you.

Gmaster, telling someone it doesn’t work on their base isn’t helping anyone at all. And especially when you don’t know what the fuck your talking about. Stick to leeching, not teaching.

Read full topic

item.title: Fire spell boolean
item.dc:creator: @gmaster1440 gmaster1440
item.description:
@gmaster1440 wrote:

First of all, else if (command.startsWith("fire on")) { String name = command.substring(8).replaceAll("_"," "); int Spot = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client s = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Spot]; firespell(0, absY, absX, foffsetY, foffsetX, 0, 500, 353, 4, 4, 354, s.absY, s.absX); }
Isn’t a boolean.

Second of all, do you know what a null means?
Exact definition of a null:Null is a special value for a pointer (or other kind of object reference) used to signify that the pointer intentionally does not have a target

Now that we know what a null is, when you activate your “fire on” spell, its target “graphical” effect doesn’t exist (at least not in your server source).

Try using that spell on a different server.

Good Luck

Read full topic

item.title: Fire spell boolean
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

ok i recently found this boolean, and i got it working in my spells all acept for the create projectile part. i have this

else if (command.startsWith("fire on"))
{
String name = command.substring(8).replaceAll("_"," ");
int Spot = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client s = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Spot];
firespell(0, absY, absX, foffsetY, foffsetX, 0, 500, 353, 4, 4, 354, s.absY, s.absX);
}

and it doesnt work, it shows the spell i chose to hit them but the moving gfx is nowere to be seen. i worked with it last night and if i added a few numbers and made the target just like 2 south of my y then it apeared and flew 3 to my west, when i use this command i cant c it at all, so can someone explain what i did wrong?
ps: what is a null gfx, i want the first “0” to be nothing, is there a grafix that doesnt do nething that i cud use?

Read full topic
